member.name: HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_KEY
member.summary: TheHTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_KEY structure serves as the key by which a given Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) certificate record is identified. It appears in the and the structures, and is passed as the pConfigInformation parameter to,, and when the ConfigId parameter is set to HttpServiceConfigSSLCertInfo.

summary.para: Pointer to a sockaddr structure that contains the Internet Protocol (IP) address with which this SSL certificate is associated.

If the sin_addr field in IpPort is set to 0.0.0.0, the certificate is applicable to all IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. If the sin6_addr field in IpPort is set to [.], the certificate is applicable to all IPv6 addresses.
